```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

# Combine all datasets for Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok
combined_data <- bind_rows(
  # Instagram
  bind_rows(
    infcharins_en %>% mutate(dataset = "Instagram EN"),
    infcharins_nl %>% mutate(dataset = "Instagram NL")
  ) %>%
    mutate(platform = "Instagram"),
  
  # YouTube
  bind_rows(
    infcharyt_en %>% mutate(dataset = "YouTube EN"),
    infcharyt_nl %>% mutate(dataset = "YouTube NL")
  ) %>%
    mutate(platform = "YouTube"),
  
  # TikTok
  bind_rows(
    infchartt_en %>% mutate(dataset = "TikTok EN"),
    infchartt_nl %>% mutate(dataset = "TikTok NL")
  ) %>%
    mutate(platform = "TikTok")
)

# Set the order of factor levels for the facet
combined_data$platform <- factor(
  combined_data$platform,
  levels = c("Instagram", "YouTube", "TikTok")
)

# Create the faceted histogram
ggplot(combined_data, aes(x = avg_hashtag_per_post, fill = dataset)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 20, color = "black", alpha = 0.7, position = "identity") +
  labs(
    x = "Average Hashtags per Post",
    y = "Count",
    title = "Histogram of Average Hashtags per Post"
  ) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c(
    "Instagram EN"= "lightblue","YouTube EN"= "lightblue","TikTok EN" = "lightblue","Instagram NL"= "orange","YouTube NL"= "orange","TikTok NL" = "orange"
  )) +
  facet_wrap(~ platform, scales = "free") +
  theme_minimal()

```
